parts.text: {"word":"elevate","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(物理的に)持ち上げる、高くする、昇降させる","english_definition":"to raise or lift something to a higher position.","examples":[{"sentence":"The platform was elevated to give everyone a better view.","translation":"全員が見やすいように、壇が持ち上げられた。"},{"sentence":"Elevate your feet to reduce swelling.","translation":"腫れを軽減するために足を高くしてください。"},{"sentence":"The crane elevated the heavy machinery to the top of the building.","translation":"クレーンは重機をビルの屋上まで持ち上げた。"}],"collocations":["elevate something to a higher level (～をより高いレベルに引き上げる)","elevate the spirits (気分を高める)","elevate the heart rate (心拍数を上げる)"],"synonyms":["lift","raise","hoist","uplift","exalt"],"antonyms":["lower","drop","descend","depress"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(地位・身分・評価などを)高める、昇進させる、向上させる","english_definition":"":"to raise someone to a higher rank or social standing; to improve the quality or status of something.","examples":[{"sentence":"He was elevated to the position of CEO.","translation":"彼はCEOの地位に昇進した。"},{"sentence":"The new policy aims to elevate the quality of education.","translation":"新しい政策は教育の質を高めることを目的としている。"},{"sentence":"She elevated the conversation to a more intellectual level.","translation":"彼女は会話を知的なレベルに高めた。"}],"collocations":["elevate someone to a position (～をある地位に昇進させる)","elevate the status of something (～の地位を高める)","elevate the discourse (議論のレベルを高める)"],"synonyms":["promote","upgrade","advance","enhance","improve","aggrandize"],"antonyms":["demote","degrade","lower","reduce","abase"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(感情・精神などを)高揚させる、鼓舞する","english_definition":"":"to raise the spirits or mood of someone; to inspire or uplift.","examples":[{"sentence":"The music elevated her spirits.","translation":"その音楽は彼女の気分を高揚させた。"},{"sentence":"His speech elevated the audience.","translation":"彼の演説は聴衆を鼓舞した。"},{"sentence":"Acts of kindness can elevate the human spirit.","translation":"親切な行為は人間の精神を高揚させることができる。"}],"collocations":["elevate the spirits (気分を高揚させる)","elevate the soul (魂を高める)","elevate the mind (精神を高める)"],"synonyms":["uplift","inspire","excite","stimulate","animate","invigorate"],"antonyms":["depress","discourage","dishearten","dampen"]}],"etymology":{"value":"ラテン語の \"elevare\" (持ち上げる、軽くする) に由来。\"e-\" (外へ) + \"levare\" (軽くする、持ち上げる) から構成される。\"levare\" は \"levis\" (軽い) に関連する。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈelɪveɪt/","syllables":"el-e-vate"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["elevate","elevates"],"past_simple":"elevated","past_participle":"elevated","present_participle":"elevating"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**elevate**」は、物理的な意味での「持ち上げる」だけでなく、地位、質、感情などを高めるという抽象的な意味でも使われます。物理的な意味では、物体を文字通り高い位置に移動させることを指します。抽象的な意味では、人々の社会的地位を向上させたり、議論のレベルを高めたり、気分を高揚させたりすることを意味します。フォーマルな文脈で使われることが多い単語です。","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The elevator elevated me to the top floor.","correct":"✓ The elevator took me to the top floor.","note":"「elevator」は「elevate」するものではなく、「take」するものです。エレベーターが人を「elevate」するという表現は不自然です。"},{"incorrect":"✗ He elevated his salary.","correct":"✓ He received a salary increase. / ✓ His salary was increased.","note":"「elevate」は「salary」そのものを高めるのではなく、人の地位や役職が高まることで結果的に給与が上がるという文脈で使われます。給与が直接上がる場合は、「salary increase」や「salary was increased」を使う方が自然です。"},{"incorrect":"✗ The music elevated my feeling.","correct":"✓ The music elevated my spirits. / ✓ The music lifted my spirits.","note":"「feeling」よりも「spirits」を使う方がより一般的です。「spirits」は気分や精神状態を表すのに適しています。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["elevation (名詞: 高さ、標高、昇進、高揚)","elevator (名詞: エレベーター)","elevated (形容詞: 高い、高尚な、高揚した)"],"idioms_phrases":["elevated railway (高架鉄道)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1","frequency_google_ngram":"中頻度","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"「**elevate**」は、何かを物理的に高い位置に持ち上げること、または地位や質、感情などを高めることを意味する少しフォーマルな単語です。例えば、建物の「elevation（高さ、立面図）」や、エレベーターで「elevate（昇る）」というように使われます。また、「elevate someone's status（地位を高める）」や「elevate the discussion（議論を高める）」のように、抽象的な意味でも使われます。日常会話よりも、ビジネスや学術的な文脈でよく使われる単語です。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The bridge was designed to **elevate** traffic over the river.","translation":"その橋は、川の上の交通を高くするために設計された。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"(物理的に)持ち上げる"},{"sentence":"The company decided to **elevate** him to the position of vice president.","translation":"会社は彼を副社長の地位に昇進させることを決定した。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"(地位などを)高める"},{"sentence":"The inspiring speech **elevated** the audience's spirits.","translation":"感動的なスピーチは聴衆の気分を高揚させた。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"(感情などを)高揚させる"},{"sentence":"The doctor advised him to **elevate** his leg to reduce swelling.","translation":"医師は彼に腫れを軽減するために足を高くするように勧めた。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"(物理的に)持ち上げる"},{"sentence":"The museum's goal is to **elevate** public awareness of art.","translation":"美術館の目標は、芸術に対する一般の意識を高めることである。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"(地位などを)高める"}]}
